awd_titl_txt: IUCRC Planning Grant Rutgers University: Center for Standards and Ethics in Artificial Intelligence (CSEAI)
awd_abstract_narration:
The last twenty years have seen an unprecedented growth of AI-enabled technologies in practically every industry. More recently, an emphasis has been placed on ensuring industry and government agencies that use or produce AI-enabled technology have a social responsibility to protect consumers and increase trustworthiness in products and services. As a result, regulatory groups are producing standards for artificial intelligence (AI) ethics worldwide. The Center for Standards and Ethics in Artificial Intelligence (CSEAI) aims to provide industry and government the necessary resources for adopting and efficiently implementing standards and ethical practices in AI through research, outreach, and education.  

CSEAI’s mission is to work closely with industry and government research partners to study AI protocols, procedures, and technologies that enable the design, implementation, and adoption of safe, effective, and ethical AI standards. The varied AI skillsets of CSEAI faculty enable the center to address various fundamental research challenges associated with the responsible, equitable, traceable, reliable, and governable development of AI-fueled technologies.  For example, the center site at Rutgers University will examine intelligible model explanations for deeply sensed environments and cyber-physical systems, privacy-aware learning for sensing applications, and federated learning for nonconvex problems.

The CSEAI will help industry and government organizations that use or produce AI technology to provide standardized, ethical products safe for consumers and users, helping the public regain trust and confidence in AI technology. The center will recruit, train, and mentor undergraduates, graduate students, and postdocs from diverse backgrounds, motivating them to pursue careers in AI ethics and producing a diverse workforce trained in standardized and ethical AI. The center will release specific ethics assessment tools, and AI best practices will be licensed or made available to various stakeholders through publications, conference presentations, and the CSEAI summer school.

Both a publicly accessible repository and a secured members-only repository (comprising meeting materials, workshop information, research topics and details, publications, etc.) will be maintained either on-site at Baylor University and/or on a government/DoD-approved cloud service. A single public and secured repository will be used for CSEAI, where permissible, to facilitate continuity of efforts and information between the different sites. This repository will be accessible at a publicly listed URL at Baylor University, https://cseai.center, for the lifetime of the center and moved to an archiving service once no longer maintained.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

perf_inst.perf_inst_name: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

por.por_cntn:
Rutgers University's Center for Standards and Ethics in Artificial Intelligence: A Report on the IUCRC Planning Grant

Introduction

Rutgers University's Center for Standards and Ethics in Artificial Intelligence (CSEAI) has made significant strides in advancing the field of artificial intelligence (AI). Focusing on the development of ethical standards and practices, the CSEAI initiative aligns with the National Science Foundation's criteria for intellectual merit and broader impacts, marking a substantial contribution to the realm of AI.

Major Contributions of CSEAI

1. Industry Engagement and Customer Discovery:

The center has successfully engaged with over 51 leading companies in the AI and technology sectors, capturing a diverse range of perspectives. This engagement was particularly evident during the IUCRC CSEAI Planning Meeting, which saw active participation from industry representatives. Their invaluable insights were instrumental in shaping the strategic direction and research priorities of the center.

2. Research and Collaboration:

CSEAI has bolstered its efforts through enhanced collaborations with Baylor University and the University of Miami. This synergy has been pivotal in strengthening member recruitment and establishing a robust foundation for the center. Furthermore, the center has been proactive in engaging with industry experts, sparking critical research questions centered around responsible AI practices and setting AI ethics standards.

3. Educational and Professional Development:

The initiative has placed a strong emphasis on educational and professional development. It has provided ample opportunities for training through conference participation, collaborative learning experiences, and workshops. Additionally, graduate students and postdocs have been actively involved in organizing events and managing academic meetings, which has greatly enriched their professional skills and expanded their networks.

4. Dissemination and Public Engagement:

CSEAI has been vigorous in disseminating its project results, making appearances at both industry-focused and academic conferences. Beyond the academic realm, the center has made significant efforts to enhance the public understanding of AI. This has been achieved through a variety of outreach activities and the utilization of online platforms, targeting both academic and non-traditional audiences.

5. Societal Impact:

The project's focus on ethical AI practices and standards is poised to have a considerable societal impact. It advocates for responsible AI use and aims to elevate public awareness and understanding of these crucial issues.

The CSEAI initiative at Rutgers University represents a landmark in the field of AI, particularly in the domain of ethics and standards. Its interdisciplinary approach, which melds industry-academia collaboration with educational efforts, has laid down a strong foundation for future research and societal contributions in the field of responsible AI. This initiative is a testament to the potential of collaborative efforts in shaping the ethical landscape of emerging technologies.

 

 


Last Modified: 12/13/2023
Modified by: Jorge J Ortiz
